title: Data Center Technician, Global Server Operations
description:
At Google, we have a vision of empowerment and equitable opportunity for all Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples and commit to building reconciliation through Google’s technology, platforms and people and we welcome Indigenous applicants. Please see ourReconciliation Action Plan for more information.
  
  

**Minimum qualifications:**  

* Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
* 2 years of experience diagnosing and troubleshooting one of the following: operating systems and computer/server hardware or networking protocols.
* Experience with performing component\-level repairs on IT equipment.
* Ability to lift/move 50lb (23kg) of equipment and ability to exert yourself physically over extended periods of time, including frequent bending, kneeling, climbing, pushing/pulling and lifting.
* Ability to work non\-standard hours, including working weekends, holidays and on shift\-based schedule as required.


**Preferred qualifications:**  

* Certification in the online Google IT Support Professional program.
* Experience working within a data center or network operation center environment.
* Ability to collaborate and partner with teams to overcome challenges.
* Ability to adapt to changes in a dynamic work environment.


About the job
  
  

Google isn't just a software company. The Hardware Operations team is responsible for monitoring the state\-of\-the\-art physical infrastructure behind Google's powerful search technology. As an Operations Technician, you'll install, configure, test, troubleshoot and maintain hardware (like servers and its components) and server software (like Google's Linux cluster). You'll also take on the configuration of more complex components such as networks, routers, hubs, bridges, switches and networking protocols. You'll participate in or lead small project teams on larger installations and develop project contingency plans. A typical day involves manual movement and installation of racks, and while it can sometimes be physically demanding, you are excited to work with infrastructure that is at the cutting\-edge of computer technology.
  
Successful candidates will be required to obtain TS NV1 clearance under the Australian Government Protective Security Policy Framework (PSPF).
  
Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.
  
  

Responsibilities
  
  

* Deploy and operate new data center infrastructure across projects or functions.
* Report issues and follow data center procedures to troubleshoot and diagnose straightforward issues with equipment or infrastructure as they arise, and applying the resources needed to resolve identified issues.
* Maintain the security and integrity of data, track various forms of media to check for standard data security issues (e.g., data was not properly erased) handled in accordance with Google security standards.
* Disassemble specific equipment that has reached its end\-of\-life via part replacement or maintenance, in a team setting.
* Repair, fix, and perform preventative maintenance on equipment, servers, machines, or infrastructure based on identified issues with defined solutions and limited guidance.


Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See alsoGoogle's EEO Policy andEEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing ourAccommodations for Applicants form.

title: Business Analyst (Cloud Adoption & Delivery)
description:
**Req ID:** 74906
  
**Department:** Tech CDIS Cloud Adoption and Delivery
  
**Division:** Technology
  
**Location:** Melbourne
  
About Us
  
  

At ANZ, we're shaping a world where people and communities thrive, driven by a common goal: to improve the financial wellbeing and sustainability of our millions of customers.
  
  

About the Role
  
  

As a Business / Data Analyst within the Cloud Adoption \& Delivery Technology Tribe, you will work very closely with our divisional aligned cloud success partners (product owners) to ensure the execution of the accelerated engineering program for cloud and co\-lo migration. You will proactively work and maintain the program schedule using agile methodologies while playing a key role in bridging the gap between business needs and technology solutions by understanding the data and delivery landscape.
  
  

Collaborate closely with internal customers to build a shared application roadmap using project management skills and artifacts for Cloud and Colo migration. You must keep a high level of senior stakeholder management, cross functional team collaboration and bring in industry best practices for managing large program scope. You will collaborate with internal teams addressing all current and future drivers of change (i.e., ALM), driving the roadmap to completion with engagement into the relevant CDIS (Cloud Data Infrastructure Services) teams.
  
  

What will your day look like?
  
  

Build and maintain project schedule ensuring data accuracy using JIRA, Qlik, Service Now, automation and other data analytic tools.
  
Analyse, model and interpret data from multiple sources and clearly present a range of metrics for senior leaders.
  
Communicate with stakeholders and translate business needs into solutions.
  
Work with ambiguity, managing competing priorities and consulting with multiple stakeholders.
  
Engage with the internal customer and stakeholders to ensure you are working on the right deliverables and they represent value to them.
  
Tackling complex problems and use critical thinking, network, skills, knowledge, and available data to drive better outcomes for our customers and the bank.
  
Find your own development areas, seeking feedback and providing feedback to others to help them learn and grow everyday!
  
What will you bring?
  
Expertise in JIRA reporting (using queries) and automation.
  
Expertise in Qlik usage (data analytics and producing reports) \& development.
  
Strong confluence skills
  
Strong PMO skills
  
Strong Excel and PowerPoint skills
  
Solid understanding of ServiceNow
  
Exceptional communication and people skills to facilitate business analysis outcomes with large senior stakeholder groups
  
Experience in translating requirements into user stories and acceptance criteria.
  
Experience coordinating and delivering reporting.
  
Strong awareness of banking and finance industry trends and threats (technology, products, regulatory environment, competitors, innovations)
  
Ability to identify opportunities for continuous improvement and implement solutions to perform more effective and efficient analysis
  
Enterprise mindset / experience
  
Your Career at ANZ
  
  

Our purpose is to shape a world where people and communities thrive. That's why we strive to create a balanced, sustainable economy in which everyone can take part and build a better life. By helping people make the most of what they have, we transform ideas, hard work and ambition into reality.
  
  

Career development means different things to different people. It may simply mean developing a skill, broadening your experience by moving sideways or stretching yourself by moving to a different business. How you manage and develop your career is up to you. ANZ is committed to helping you do this by providing you with the support, tools and resources you need to take the next big step in your career, towards even bigger things in the future.
  
  

We work flexibly at ANZ and encourage you to talk to us about how this role can be flexible for you and any adjustments you may require to our recruitment process or the role itself. If you are a candidate with a disability, let us know how we can provide you with additional support.
  
  

Please refer to this link to read about recruitment and mobility principles between Suncorp Bank and ANZ.

title: Data Analyst - Data Portfolio
description:
**Req ID:** 82306
  
**Department:** AR Strategic Delivery Australia Data
  
**Division:** Australia Retail
  
**Location:** Melbourne
  
About Us
  
  

At ANZ, we're applying new ways technology and data can be harnessed as we work towards a common goal: to improve the financial wellbeing and sustainability of our millions of customers.
  
  

About the Role
  
  

As a Data Analyst within the Data Portfolio, you’ll play a key role in helping the CRR\&A Data initiatives. You will collaborate closely with a team of Data Scientists, Data Engineers, and Data Analysts, as well as business teams within the CRR\&A portfolio.
  
  

Banking is changing and we’re changing with it, giving our people great opportunities to try new things, learn and grow. Whatever your role at ANZ, you’ll be building your future, while helping to build ours.
  
  

**Role Type:** 6 month opportunity
  
**Role Location:** Melbourne
  
**Work Hours:** Full time
  
  

What will your day look like?
  
  

This role will help the CRR\&A Data team accelerate the closure of events in the backlog of our risk management system NFR Hub through a program of work designed to provide insights and improve event management processes.
  
  

As a member of the Retail Analytics CRR\&A Data team, you bring advanced data analysis expertise and a passion for leveraging data to enhance our responses to regulatory requirements.
  
  

**As a Data Analyst, your key accountabilities will include:**  

Developing management dashboards and the supporting data pipelines that contribute to regulatory reporting.
  
Developing standard Python/SQL queries and procedures to assist with the process optimisation.
  
Automating new and existing procedures and reporting workflows using Python or other scripting languages.
  
Providing data initiative support and expertise to product teams in Aus Retail and business teams within the CRR\&A portfolio.
  
Developing insights and progress reporting for stakeholders.
  
What will you bring?
  
  

To grow and be successful in this role, you will ideally bring the following:
  
  

Recent and extensive experience in a Data Analyst or Data Engineering role.
  
Extensive knowledge and experience with tools and techniques for analysis, data manipulation and presentation (e.g., Python, SQL, Tableau, QlikSense).
  
Analytical and inquisitive mindset to continuously improve the level of insight surfaced.
  
Strong ability to translate data insights into practical business recommendations.
  
Strong data visualisation skills.
  
Ability to effectively communicate to all stakeholders (technical and non\-technical).
  
Data engineering tools (e.g., dbt, Spark, Airflow)
  
Experience with Big Data/Cloud platforms and technologies (Hadoop, Kubernetes)
  
Knowledge Management platforms and practices (GitHub, Confluence)
  
Degree qualifications in Data Science, Computer Science, Information Technology, Information Statistics, Applied Mathematics, or equivalent industry experience in data analysis, engineering, or related fields.
  
  

You’re not expected to have 100% of these skills. At ANZ a growth mindset is at the heart of our culture, so if you have most of these things in your toolbox, we’d love to hear from you.
  
  

So why join us?
  
  

From the moment you join ANZ, you'll be doing meaningful work that will shape a world where people and communities thrive.
  
  

But it's not just our customers who'll feel your impact. You'll feel it too. Because at ANZ, you'll have the resources, opportunities, and support you need to take the next big step in your career.
  
  

We're a diverse bunch at ANZ in different roles, different locations, doing different things. That's why we have a range of flexible working arrangements, so our people can 'make work, work for them'. We also provide a range of benefits including access to health and wellbeing services and discounts on selected products and services from ANZ and more.
  
  

At ANZ, you'll be part of an organisation where the different backgrounds, perspectives and life experiences of our people are celebrated. That's because we're committed to building a workplace that reflects the diversity of the communities we serve. We welcome applications from everyone and encourage you to talk to us about any adjustments you may require to our recruitment process or the role itself. If you're a candidate with a disability or access requirement, and have an enquiry about the support provided, please let us know on your application or visit ANZ Accessibility and Inclusion Programs for alternate contact methods.
  
  

. You can apply for this role by visiting ANZ Careers and searching for reference number 82306 .
  
  

Job Posting End Date
  
  

10/12/2024 , 11\.59pm, (Melbourne Australia)

title: Finance Analyst
description:
Advertisement Text  

**Position Title:** **Finance Analyst**  

**Employment Type: Maximum Term,** **Full Time (12 months)**  

**Hours per week: 38**  

**Position Grade:** **Health Services Manager Level 1**  

**Salary:** **$81,581\.00 \-** **$108,532\.00****base salary per annum**  

**Enterprise Agreement:** **The Named NSW (Non\-Declared) Affiliated Health Organisations’ Health Employees Agreement 2019**  

**Department Name:** **Management Accounting \& Revenue** **About us:**  

St Vincent’s Hospital Sydney is a leading not\-for\-profit organisation providing health services to our community. Guided by our values of compassion, excellence, integrity and justice, we promote a culture of diversity and inclusion and empower our people to learn, grow and innovate.  

  

**Benefits of working at St Vincent’s include:**  

* Generous salary packaging and Fitness Passport for eligible staff
* Opportunity to access a wide of range of clinical and non\-clinical education programs
* Supported post graduate opportunities within applicable fields
* Career development opportunities across the St Vincent’s Health Australia Network
* Employee Assistance Program
* Work/Life balance
 **About the role:**  

We are seeking a motivated and detail\-oriented **Finance Analyst** to join our dynamic team at St Vincent’s Hospital. In this role, you will play a pivotal part in supporting the hospital’s financial planning, analysis, and reporting functions. You will work closely with stakeholders across the organization to provide insights that drive decision\-making and contribute to the delivery of exceptional healthcare services. **As a Finance Analyst, you will:*** Collaborate with department leaders to prepare budgets, forecasts, and financial reports.
* Analyze financial performance, identify trends, and provide actionable recommendations.
* Support the preparation of monthly management reports, ensuring accuracy and timeliness.
* Contribute to financial modelling and scenario analysis for strategic initiatives.
* Assist in streamlining processes and implementing financial best practices.

  

This is an exciting opportunity to be part of a mission\-driven organization that values innovation, collaboration, and excellence in patient care. If you’re ready to make a meaningful impact while advancing your career, we’d love to hear from you!  

  

**Diversity and Inclusion at St Vincent's:**  

St Vincent's is committed to employing a workforce that reflects the community we care for. We strongly encourage applications from people that are Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander, culturally diverse, sexuality or gender diverse and/or living with disability.  

Employment with St Vincent's is subject to you having current immunity status that complies with the Occupational Assessment, Screening \& Vaccination against Specified Infectious Diseases \- NSW Health Policy Directive (PD2024\_015\) or subsequent revisions in force. Appointment and ongoing employment will be subject to continued compliance with this policy directive. **About you:**  

You are a proactive and analytical professional with a passion for delivering financial insights that drive meaningful outcomes. With a strong attention to detail and excellent problem\-solving skills, you thrive in a dynamic environment where collaboration and innovation are key. Your ability to communicate complex financial information clearly makes you a trusted advisor to stakeholders at all levels. **Application Instructions:**  

To have your application considered you are required to upload a current CV/Resume as well as a separate cover letter/document addressing the ‘Selection Criteria’ as below. Internal applicants i.e. current employees of St Vincent’s Hospital or an entity of SVHA are required to apply via their Workday account.  

  

**Selection Criteria:*** Personal integrity and demonstrated commitment to the Philosophy, Mission and Values of Mary Aikenhead Ministries and St Vincent’s Health Australia.
* Degree in Finance, Accounting, Commerce or a related field (CPA/CA qualification is highly regarded).
* Ability to engage, influence and form positive and productive relationships with a wide range of stakeholders including senior leaders.
* Experience working in the healthcare industry, including knowledge of public hospital revenue, funding, arrangements and common cost drivers.
* Exceptional analytical and problem\- solving abilities, with a focus on accuracy and efficiency.
* An aptitude for data analysis, budget and management reporting using Microsoft Excel, Power BI and Oracle’s computerised financial accounting systems.

 **Shortlisting for this position will commence immediately. We encourage you to apply promptly as the advertisement may close early should a suitable applicant be sourced.** **Applications close on 24 December 2024** **For more information, and to apply please click** **here**

title: Clinical Genetics - Admin Officer (Part-Time)
description:
**Employment Type**: Permanent Part Time  

**Position Classification**: Admin Off Lvl 3  

**Remuneration**: 68338\.79 \- 70468\.72 full time equivalent base salary range (excludes super, leave loading and salary packaging)  

**Hours Per Week**: 23  

**Requisition ID**: REQ537985  


Sydney Children's Hospitals Network is the largest paediatric health care entity in Australia. We care for thousands of children each year in our hospitals and in their homes — with one purpose in mind — to help young people live their healthiest lives.



Click here to learn more about our Network


**Additional information:**


* An eligibility list may be created for future permanent part time and temporary part time vacancies.
Work days \- Friday is essential and non\-negotiable; other work days \- Monday is preferable, other days are flexible.  

  

**What you'll be doing**  

The Admin Officer is responsible for administrative support for the Department of Clinical Genetics as directed by the Head of Department and is required to maintain a sound knowledge of the activities of the department so as to support its aims and objectives. Show initiative and independence in decision making for day to day operational matters, with support and broad supervision of HOD and Senior Secretary.
  

Primary roles include but are not limited to:
  

* Reception duties \- to receive patients and answer phone calls, assist clinical staff with triage of calls
* Type and mail letters or reports, scan and file documents, distribute mail and files
* Assist more senior staff including counsellors, doctors and other administrative staff with clinic coordination

Other complex tasks or projects as directed by the Head of Department to support the clinical activities of the Department of Clinical Genetics
* Reception / administrative skills and experience in handling diverse medical, para\-medical and public enquiries.


* Proven organisational skills, ability to show initiative and prioritise workload and ability to work as part of a team and with minimal supervision.


* Experience with outpatient clinic bookings or clinic co\-ordination and Medicare billing.


* Excellent telephone manner and oral and written communication skills.


* Knowledge of Microsoft Office (eg. Word, Excel, Power Point, Outlook).


* Knowledge of medical terminology and understanding of patient confidentiality.


* Audio\-transcription experience with a typing speed of at least 60wpm and qualification in medical terminology (or working towards). Sound knowledge of English grammar as is relevant for correspondence.


* Data entry, knowledge and skill in database maintenance.



SCHN is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values diversity \- we acknowledge the vibrancy that a diverse workforce brings to enhance both our workplace culture and our service delivery to children, young people and their families and carers. Existing staff of SCHN and those seeking employment are required to prioritise the safety, welfare and wellbeing of children and young people in their care and take action to keep them safe from harm and abuse.

title: Data Quality Officer
description:
* Monthly Paid ADO, extra to annual leave (Full\-time staff only).
* Excellent leave benefits aligned with NSW Health (State) award.
* Reduce taxable income \& boost take\-home pay with Salary Packaging.

  



Drive data accuracy, resolve patient record issues, and shape digital health advancements in a dynamic healthcare team. Apply Now!  


**Employment Type:** Temporary Full and Part Time roles available (up to 16/01/2028\)  

**Position Classification:** Administration Officer Level 3
  

**Remuneration:** $33\.30 \- $34\.33 per hour  

**Hours Per Week:** up to 38  

**Location:** Various sites across WSLHD

  


**Where you'll be working**
  

Western Sydney Local Health District (WSLHD) provides essential health services to western Sydney residents, guided by core values of collaboration, openness, respect, and empowerment. This role supports data quality to improve healthcare delivery.
* Role: Health Informatics Data Quality Officer, ensuring accurate patient data.
* Key tasks: Resolve duplicate registrations, update patient identifiers, and perform data quality checks.
* Works with: Administrative staff and the Health Information and Records Service team.
* Focus: Prepares for the Single Digital Patient Record (SDPR) implementation.
* Shifts: Flexible, 8:00–16:30 or 16:00–12:30, across WSLHD facilities.

  


**What you'll be doing**  

The Health Informatics Data Quality Officer plays a vital role in ensuring accurate patient information within Western Sydney Local Health District's systems, supporting high\-quality healthcare delivery and readiness for digital advancements.
* Ensure accurate data in Patient Administration System and eHR.
* Resolve duplicate patient records and update key identifiers.
* Conduct data quality checks and report on findings.
* Collaborate with the Health Information and Records Service team.
* Support preparation for the Single Digital Patient Record (SDPR).

  


**How to Apply**  

Apply online by submitting your resume and addressing the criteria listed below by providing examples that demonstrate your ability before the closing date.

  



* Experience in an administrative or customer service position and/or knowledge and experience in health administrative functions.


* Demonstrated ability to prioritise and organise your workload so that you are able to meet deadlines.


* Proven attention to detail with the ability to identify and correct errors.


* Developed computer skills and/or experience with document imaging, patient administrations systems and Microsoft Office suite.


* Excellent customer service skills with sound oral and written communication skills.


* Demonstrated ability to work as a productive team member, contribute to a positive team culture and work across all WSLHD facilities as required.


* Demonstrated understanding of privacy and confidentiality principles and how they are applied in the hospital setting.
  


**Requisition ID: REQ532217**

***Please be aware that due to the Christmas / New Year period, there may be a delay in the progress of your application.******The convenor of this position may not be in contact with you until the new year if you are successful in obtaining an interview.***

title: Senior Marketing Associate, Business Relationship Management, Sydney
description:
Senior Marketing Associate, Business Relationship Management, Sydney


**Requisition ID:** 47410
**Business Unit:** Fitch Ratings
**Category:** Business Development \& Sales
**Location:**Sydney, NSW, AU
**Date Posted:** Dec 3, 2024
At Fitch, we have an open culture where employees are able to exchange ideas and perspectives, throughout the organization, irrespective of their seniority. Your voice will be heard allowing you to have a real impact. We embrace diversity and appreciate authenticity encouraging an environment where employees can be their true selves. Our inclusive and progressive approach helps us to keep a balanced perspective. Fitch is also committed to supporting its employees by advancing conversations around diversity, equity and inclusion. Fitch’s Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) have been established by employees who have joined together as a workplace community based on similar backgrounds or life experiences. Fitch’s ERGs are available to connect employees with others within the organization to offer professional and personal support.  


With our expertise, we are not only creating data and information, but also producing timely insights from every angle to influence decision making in this ever changing and highly competitive market. We have a relentless hunger to innovate and unlock the power of human insights and to drive value for our customers. There has never been a better time to make an impact and we invite you to join us on this journey.  


Fitch Ratings is a leading provider of credit ratings, commentary and research. Dedicated to providing value beyond the rating through independent and prospective credit opinions, Fitch Ratings offers global perspectives shaped by strong local market experience and credit market expertise. The additional context, perspective and insights we provide have helped fund a century of growth and enables you to make important credit judgments with confidence.



Fitch Ratings Australian Business Relationship Management (BRM) team currently consists of three managers covering all asset classes in Australia and New Zealand. The team works closely with the wider BRM team across Asia\-Pacific. We are currently seeking a Senior Market Research Associate based out of our Sydney office to provide tactical marketing and business development management support.  

  

**What We Offer:**
* Professional development and career growth opportunities, across a variety of sectors (Corporate, Project Finance, Public Finance, Structured Finance and Financial Institutions).
* Opportunities to build high\-profile relationships with issuers, bankers, investors, and other market participants.
* High visibility in a strongly performing regional team that has been growing revenue strongly over many years.
* Collaboration amongst internal divisions including relationship, analytical, finance and marketing teams.
* Significant travel opportunities throughout Australia and New Zealand.
* Hybrid working model.
* Collaborative working environment and a Diversity and Inclusion working culture.


**We’ll Count on You To:**
* Support BRM initiatives for the Australian office.
* Compile various billings, accounting and internal performance reports.
* Co\-ordinate revenue analysis of applicable customer relationships.
* Organise Fitch\-hosted and Fitch\-sponsored events in Australia and New Zealand.
* Provide cover for other BRM team members in their absence.
* Support investor development and outreach in Australia and New Zealand.


**BRM Support:**
* Provide a link between business relationship managers to ensure revenue objectives are met in accordance with annual plans.
* Enhance coordination with the rating analytical teams, the Investor Development Team (IDT), Fitch Solutions, Fitch Learning, Events, and SUF. Identify key deliverables from IDT to improve marketing strength.
* Compile various management reports around internal performance, including monthly revenue vs budget reports across all sectors, paying particular attention to timeliness and accuracy (SalesForce, internal management reports, weekly highlights).
* Full compliance with all Fitch policies, procedures, compliance and reporting requirements. Compliance with BRM policy manual.


**Events Management:**
* Take a role in organising all events (Fitch\-hosted and Fitch\-sponsored) in Australia and New Zealand.
* Work with rating analytical teams, local BRM and regional events team to plan, organise and manage events, with a view to raising Fitch’s overall profile in Australia and New Zealand.

After every event, provide a written event summary to stakeholders – analytical, BRM and IDT.  
* 

**Investor Development Support:**
* Work with the BRM managers and rating analytical teams to execute outreach plans throughout the year.
* Assist IDT to market relevant Fitch research products or outreach programs in a timely fashion. Address questions and connect them to the rating analytical teams when appropriate.
* Support interactions that lead to new business origination or provide a basis for the development of origination strategies.


**What You Need to Have:**
* A minimum of four years relevant marketing or relationship management experience in debt capital markets or banking/financial services sectors.
* Ability to communicate effectively with senior management and market participants on important industry issues.
* Effective presentation and negotiation skills.
* Some exposure to Bloomberg
* Good interpersonal skills and a team player.
* Good command of spoken and written English.
* Willingness to have extensive business travels.


**What Would Make You Stand Out:**
* College or MBA degree with specialisation in business, finance, or other relevant

Fitch Group is a global leader in financial information services with operations in more than 30 countries. Wholly owned by the Hearst Corporation, we are comprised of three main businesses: Fitch Ratings \| Fitch Solutions \| Fitch Learning.
For more information please visit our websites www.fitchratings.com \| www.fitchsolutions.com \| www.fitchlearning.com
Fitch is committed to providing global securities markets with objective, timely, independent and forward\-looking credit opinions. To protect Fitch’s credibility and reputation, our employees must take every precaution to avoid conflicts of interests or any appearance of a conflict of interest. Should you be successful in the recruitment process at Fitch Ratings you will be asked to declare any securities holdings and other potential conflicts prior to commencing employment. If you, or your immediate family, have any holdings that may conflict with your work responsibilities, you may be asked to divest yourself of them before beginning work.
Fitch is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender expression, gender identity or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Marketing Specialist
description:
Renaissance® is a global leader in education technology. We help schools and school groups in the UK and around the world with educational assessments, practice and intervention solutions, and data analytics. Renaissance now incorporates GL Assessment (known internationally as GL Education), too – a leading provider of educational assessments.



Together, our assessments offer the ideal starting point to help teachers understand their students' strengths and pinpoint areas of need. Our teaching and learning tools then provide effective next steps, with online literacy and maths solutions that meet students exactly where we are.



Worldwide, we support over 18 million students, operating in over 100 countries.


**About this role:**


Looking for a new role in 2025, We have a fantastic opportunity for an experienced Marketing professional to join us in our new Sydney Offices as a Marketing Specialist. We are a leading Global EdTech company with Head offices in North America, United Kingdom, France \& Australia.


**About this role:**



We are recruiting to join our team in Sydney as we look at continued growth at Renaissance within this market, we are looking for a Marketing professional who will use their expertise to partner with our sales team to drive our engagement with customers.



In this hands\-on role, you will drive end\-to\-end marketing campaigns, collaborating closely with the sales team to support business objectives. You will have the autonomy to manage the full marketing mix, with a strong emphasis on direct marketing to segmented audiences through both online and offline channels. Your creativity and strategic approach will be key in executing campaigns that generate high\-quality leads and enhance our brand presence in the EdTech market.


**Marketing Specialist's Job Responsibilities:**



As a Marketing Specialist (Known internally as a Senior Marketing Executive) you will develop, implement, and manage effective marketing campaigns that align with company goals, utilising a variety of channels to reach our target audiences. ensuring you create and manage engaging content across social media platforms to boost brand awareness and generate leads.


* Design and execute targeted email marketing campaigns to engage customers and drive conversions.
* Oversee website content updates and enhancements, ensuring it remains informative and engaging for visitors.
* Develop high\-quality content for various marketing channels, including blogs, newsletters, and promotional materials.
* Plan and execute marketing events, webinars, and trade shows to promote products and engage with customers, ensuring participation and impactful presentations.
* Work with external marketing agencies to design and execute campaigns that enhance lead generation and brand visibility.
* Monitor and analyse campaign performance metrics, using insights to refine strategies and improve ROI.
* Collaborate with internal teams to support business objectives and achieve targets.


**Skills and experience required:**



Our Ideal candidate will come from a EdTech or Education company with great market knowledge in Australia \& New Zealand, but for us we are looking for someone who is from a technology company which has a strong focus on B2B marketing, along with a proven ability to generate and execute campaigns autonomously, with a hands\-on approach to driving results.


* Excellent knowledge of marketing automation platforms and CRM systems to manage leads and measure campaign effectiveness.
* Strong understanding of design principles, with desired skills in creating compelling marketing materials.
* Proficient copywriting skills to create engaging content that resonates with target audiences.
* Ability to thrive in a fast\-paced environment and work under tight deadlines, while maintaining attention to detail
* Flexibility in working hours to accommodate occasional collaboration with international marketing teams.


**Additional information:**



We offer a base salary of up to $90,000\.00 depending on experience, this role is based out of our Darling Harbour, Sydney on a Hybrid work patterns working from the office a minimum 2 days a week.

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
We are seeking a Data Engineer to take charge of Techtalent’s data analytics infrastructure. This position offers the opportunity to build and refine Techtalent's data practices to enhance business impact. You will have significant ownership over our data and analytics platforms, contributing to team productivity and satisfaction. As we continue to grow, ensuring our data is scalable and well\-organized will be a priority! You will collaborate closely with Product and Engineering teams, working with both technical and non\-technical stakeholders to drive change.

Join our startup and product\-led growth journey at Techtalent!

This is a hybrid position based in either Melbourne or Sydney.

**Responsibilities**

* Become the primary owner of Techtalent’s data and analytics platforms.
* Maintain our analytics infrastructure and dashboards, utilizing various tools.
* Assist a small product team in making well\-informed, data\-driven decisions while aligning data strategy with broader business goals.
* Review and ensure the accuracy of our data.
* Collaborate with Product and Engineering teams to identify key metrics for success.
* Lead cross\-functional efforts around data quality, reporting, insights, and resolving data inconsistencies to answer business questions.
* Design, build, install, and maintain data processing systems and databases.
* Integrate data from multiple sources, ensuring consistency and reliability.
* Build and maintain efficient data pipelines to support the ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) process into data warehouses or data lakes.
* Optimize data processing systems for scalability and performance.
* Implement data quality checks and validation to ensure data accuracy and reliability.
* Document data processes, architecture, and workflows to ensure transparency and continuity.

**Requirements**

* Strong collaboration skills, with the ability to understand stakeholder needs and develop strategies that address them.
* Excellent communication skills, with the ability to advocate for and educate others about data best practices.
* Proficient in SQL for data wrangling.
* Experience using data modeling tools like dbt.
* Proficiency in Python or R.
* Familiarity with modern event data stacks and tools such as Segment, Amplitude, Looker Studio, BigQuery, Google Analytics, and AWS/GCP (preferred).
* A clear vision for building a leading\-edge analytics stack and a strategy for its development.
* A solid foundation in mathematics and statistics.
* Strong numerical and visual skills, with the ability to simplify complex data insights.
* Experience with data systems supporting machine learning, and familiarity with database migration or modernization projects (preferred).
* Experience with A/B Testing is highly desirable.

Job Type: Full\-time

Benefits:

* Salary packaging
* Work from home

Application Question(s):

* Do you have PR or Australian Citizenship?
* Would you require sponsorship in the future?

Work Authorisation:

* Australia (Preferred)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in North Sydney, NSW 2060

Application Deadline: 29/12/2024

title: Security Administrator - RRJV
description:
We currently have an opportunity for a **Security Administrator** to join our team. This position will support the Riverina Redevelopment Joint Venture (RRJV), which is a 50/50 joint venture between Downer and CPB Contractors to undertake major upgrades and replacement of existing Defence infrastructure and facilities.  



We are seeking candidates to be part of our team on the redevelopment project, covering the Albury Wodonga Military Area, Blamey Barracks (Kapooka) and the RAAF Base Wagga.  



This is a site based role in the Albury\-Wodonga region.  



As a Security Administrator, you will play a crucial role in supporting the Security team ensure the project complies with all requirements of the Defence Industry Security Program (DISP) and supporting staff and contractors with their security clearance and access requirements.  



**Key responsibilities:**

* Collaborate with the Security Officer to ensure compliance with Defence Industry Security Program (DISP) requirements and maintain quality documentation.
* Provide direct support to operational staff and sub\-contractors, ensuring security clearances and Defence Common Access Cards (DCAC) are obtained and maintained promptly.
* Support personnel security processes, including clearance requests, annual awareness training, and reporting of changes in circumstances or vulnerabilities.
* Safeguard sensitive and classified materials, maintain security registers, and ensure compliance with policies and procedures for security incidents.
* Support the Chief Security Officer with assurance activities, including security performance reporting and compliance audits.
Communicate and implement security policies and plans, providing relevant updates and training through toolboxes and briefings.  
* 

**What you’ll bring**

* Hold or able to obtain a Government Security Clearance (Australian citizen) – must have
* Experience in a similar role will be highly regarded
* Demonstrate a high level of detail and accuracy of work
* Experience in communicating with internal and external stakeholders
* Demonstrated accuracy in data entry
Passionate about promoting a positive culture towards security  
* 

More than anything, you’ll have a strong work ethic, a positive attitude, and a drive to provide high quality outcomes for the Social Infrastructure and Citizen Services business unit and our clients.  



Spotless Management Services Pty Ltd (a Downer Company) is delivering the works as part of a joint venture with CPB Contractors Pty Ltd. Accordingly we will share your Personal Information, to the extent necessary, for the purpose of recruitment for the joint venture with CPB Contractors Pty Ltd who are required to handle that information in accordance with the *Privacy Act 1988* (Cth).


**Note \- this role has a target start date of March 2025\.**

**Why work for us?**

Working for the Social Infrastructure and Citizen Services business unit, means every day you will be enabling our communities to thrive. With a bright future ahead of us, you find purpose here and have the opportunity to directly impact and contribute positively to our future. You’ll also find a range of benefits available such as:  



* Training and development to support your career.
* Internal career opportunities across the Downer Group business.
* Affordable healthcare covers, discounted car purchase and rental (with selected brands), and other retail discounts.
An Employee Assistance Program providing access to professionals to support you (and your family) to achieve your personal or professional goals through wellbeing coaching, counselling, financial advice, legal advice and more.  
* 

This exciting role offers you the opportunity to work in a dynamic environment with a highly successful organisation. If you are passionate about what you do and motivated to succeed, then **apply now.**

*Downer Group is an employer that acknowledges and embraces the importance of our people's diverse experiences, talents, and cultures. As an inclusive employer, we welcome applications from everyone.*

title: People and Culture Operations Administrator - Hybrid
description:
**Work options:** Hybrid **We are oOh!media (pronounced “oh!” media).**


oOh!media is the \#1 Out of Home company in Australia and New Zealand.


We exist to make public spaces better and brands unmissable, proudly leading the market with innovation, creativity, data and results. Our network plays an important role in the communities they are located, creating engaging environments that inform, entertain and inspire, while connecting brands with audiences at scale.


We are oOh!media, and we are unmissable.

**The role:**


Reporting into the Head of People \& Culture Services, you will play a key role alongside other team members in being responsible for ensuring the smooth functioning of key employee lifecycle processes, such as onboarding new hires, transfers and separations.


You’ll also be responsible for the day to day enquiry management handling via our ServiceNow portal, as well as identifying, implementing and reporting on process improvement initiatives and projects, informed by enquiry data.


The scope of your responsibilities will include:

* Creating and maintaining standard operating procedures to support key processes,
* Managing various HR systems.
* Employee on and off boarding activities
* Employee data entry and validation
* Data analysis and reporting
* Process improvement,
* Policy and legislative compliance including Awards.

**The Experience:**


We are looking for a proactive, customer focused individual with high attention to detail, a sense of urgency, good judgement and prioritisation. A proven ability to work and contribute to a team environment is essential. 1\-2 years\+ in a similar HR Operations role will set you up for success along with the following skills and experience:

* Intermediate MS Office skills, plus the ability to manage and maintain HR related systems including at an administrator level
* Sound understanding of Australian employment legislation and Awards
* Experience with a range of HRIS and HR systems, either as user or administrator
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, experience with writing procedural information is highly regarded
* Able to build solid and trusting partnerships with key stakeholders
* ‘Can do attitude” with proven ability to problem solve


Relevant tertiary studies in Human Resources, Psychology, Commerce or related fields highly desired

**Perks and Benefits:**

* Flex your way: Whether you're working partly in the office or remotely (where business allows), we give you the flexibility to make time for what matters.
* Grow sustainably: Personal and career growth is key. Through tailored training programs, development planning, NGEN memberships, and more, we’re here to help you thrive every day.
* Leave your way: From extra leave options and inclusive paid parental leave to wellbeing days and community service leave, we’ve got your back. Plus, you can swap a public holiday for a personal day of significance.
* Support for you: Your wellbeing matters. With free support through Sonder, discounted gym memberships, and online wellness perks, we help you feel your best.
* Celebrate you: Our Active Reward and Recognition Program highlights the great work you do. When you go above and beyond, we’ll make sure you’re seen and celebrated.


If you’re curious, ready for a unique challenge, and want to make a real impact, we want to hear from you!


At oOh!, we celebrate diversity and strive for an inclusive environment. We welcome applications from all backgrounds, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, people with disabilities, LGBTQIA\+ individuals, and refugees.

title: Head of Data & Insights - Technology
description:
Accent Group Limited is the leading digitally integrated retail and distribution business in the Apparel and Footwear performance and lifestyle market in Australia and New Zealand. With over 850\+ stores, 34 brands and over 30\+ online platforms. Our brands include; Glue, Platypus, Skechers, Hype DC, Vans, Dr. Martens, Subtype, The Athletes Foot, CAT, Merrell, The Trybe, Timberland, Stylerunner, Hoka, UGG, Saucony, \& Nude Lucy!
  
  

Accent Group Limited is the leading digitally integrated retail and distribution business in the Apparel and Footwear performance and lifestyle market in Australia and New Zealand. With over 850\+ stores, 34 brands and over 30\+ online platforms. Our brands include; Glue, Platypus, Skechers, Hype DC, Vans, Dr. Martens, Subtype, The Athletes Foot, CAT, Merrell, The Trybe, Timberland, Stylerunner, Hoka, UGG, Saucony, \& Nude Lucy!
  
  

We have an exciting role available for a Head of Data and Insights to join our Technology Team based in our Cremorne Office, Melbourne.
  
  

About the Role
  
  

Reporting to the General Manager of Technology, this is a rare and exciting opportunity, perfect for a strategic and organised team player. The Head of Data and Insights will be responsible for leading the organization’s data strategy, overseeing data management, and driving the use of data and analytics to deliver actionable insights that influence business decision\-making. This leadership role involves managing a cross\-functional team of data professionals and collaborating closely with other teams to ensure the effective utilization of data to improve business performance.
  
  

You will have a deep understanding of data management, advanced analytics, and business intelligence, along with a proven track record of delivering impactful insights that support business growth. You will be leading a team with resources based in Melbourne and Sydney, our ideal candidate is a seasoned technology leader who can demonstrate an understanding of retail fundamentals, data driven insights that can continue to transform our business.
  
  

**The key responsibilities will include the following:**  

**Data Strategy \& Vision:**  

* Define and implement the organization’s data and insights strategy, ensuring alignment with overall business objectives.
* Oversee the design, development and management of the organisation’s data infrastructure that supports business needs and drives data\-driven decision\-making.
* Ensure that data is managed as a strategic asset across the company and continuously look for opportunities to unlock its value.


**Business Intelligence Strategy (BI) and Execution:**  

* Define and implement the BI strategy in alignment with organizational objectives, ensuring BI solutions deliver actionable insights to all levels of the business.
* Lead the selection, implementation, and optimization of BI tools to support data visualization, reporting, and analysis needs across departments.
* Develop and maintain interactive dashboards, reports, and business intelligence applications that provide real\-time insights to key stakeholders.
* Ensure the BI tools are integrated with the data warehouse and other internal systems to provide a holistic view of organizational data.


**Advanced Analytics \& Reporting:**  

* Lead the development of advanced analytics solutions such as predictive modelling, trend analysis, and machine learning integration to enhance the organization’s capabilities.
* Oversee the creation of ad\-hoc reports and custom queries to support business decision\-making in real time.
* Ensure that insights drive business decisions, improve operational efficiency, and uncover new opportunities for growth.


**Leadership \& Team Management:**  

* Lead and inspire a team of data analysts, engineers, and insights professionals to deliver high\-quality, actionable insights.
* Foster a collaborative, innovative, and performance\-driven culture within the data and insights team.
* Build team capabilities through training, mentoring, and hiring top talent.


**Data Governance \& Quality Assurance:**  

* Establish and enforce data governance standards to ensure the integrity, accuracy, security, and privacy of data in the data warehouse and BI systems.
* Implement data quality checks and validation procedures to maintain the reliability and consistency of data across all platforms.
* Work closely with data stewards and business units to ensure data definitions and business rules are standardized and well understood.


**Cross\-functional Collaboration:**  

* Work closely with business leaders to identify data\-driven opportunities and ensure the use of insights to improve business outcomes.
* Advocate for the adoption of data\-driven decision\-making processes, promoting the use of BI tools and reports across the organization.
* Support data\-driven decision\-making across the organization by promoting data literacy and ensuring stakeholders understand how to interpret and use insights.
* Collaborate with other technology teams to ensure seamless integration of data sources and the scalability of data solutions.


**Innovation \& Continuous Improvement:**  

* Stay up\-to\-date with the latest trends and technologies in data science, analytics, and business intelligence, applying new techniques and tools to improve business performance.
* Lead the adoption of cutting\-edge data solutions, machine learning, AI, and automation to enhance data capabilities and efficiency.
* Continuously refine the data strategy to meet evolving business needs and opportunities in the marketplace.


**Stakeholder Reporting \& Communication:**  

* Present data and insights to executive leadership and key stakeholders in a clear and actionable manner.
* Be an escalation point for business leaders on data and insight queries


To be successful you will ideally have the following skills \& experience:
  
* Demonstrated 7 years of experience in data management, data warehouse, or business intelligence roles, with at least 3 years in a leadership position.
* Strong expertise in data warehouse architecture, design, and management (e.g., SQL, ETL, cloud data platforms).
* Experience in the retail industry highly regarded
* Experience managing data infrastructure projects at scale and working with cross\-functional teams to meet business intelligence needs.
* Familiarity with data governance principles and standards (desirable)
* Strong stakeholder management and team engagement capability and influence business outcomes
* Exceptional communication skills across all business facets and with partners/vendors
* Ability to identify, allocate and monitor performance of team members to successfully deliver outcomes to agreed timeframes
* Proven experience working in a fast\-paced retail culture
* Knowledge of data warehouse technologies and cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud).
* Proficiency in BI tools, data visualization, and reporting platforms (e.g., Qliksense, Power BI)
* Familiarity with data analytics and machine learning integration in BI solutions
* The role does require some flexibility to accommodate technology deployments outside of usual business hours

title: Data Engineer
description:
Xero is a beautiful, easy\-to\-use platform that helps small businesses and their accounting and bookkeeping advisors grow and thrive.  

At Xero, our purpose is to make life better for people in small business, their advisors, and communities around the world. This purpose sits at the centre of everything we do. We support our people to do the best work of their lives so that they can help small businesses succeed through better tools, information and connections. Because when they succeed they make a difference, and when millions of small businesses are making a difference, the world is a more beautiful place. **How you’ll make an impact**  

As a data engineer in the Marketing Data Science, Analytics \& Insights team, you will be responsible for engineering large and complex data sets, as well as build robust, reusable and optimized data pipelines. You will have broad technical skills of developing and implementing data pipelines as well as data infrastructure to support the implementation of data transformation for analytics, business intelligence, machine learning models and other data projects.
### **What you’ll do**

* + Create integration between Xero’s Kafka infrastructure, Customer Data platform and other OLAP systems
	+ Deploy data pipelines following DevOps principles and incorporating automated code \& data testing.
	+ Demonstrates a focus on continual self improvement, across both the technical and business aspects of delivering high quality data enrichment solutions
	+ Provide support to data quality and data validation through analysis of data and assisting in understanding the meaning of data
	+ Help drive continuous improvements to data quality procedures and a consistent approach to how data quality is measured, monitored and reported.
	+ Work on incident management, service requests, enhancements/changes and audits

### **What you’ll bring with you**

* + Strong data and technical background demonstrating innovation, initiative and a passion for data
	+ Confidence in collecting, collating and interpreting business requirements in order to produce quality outcomes
	+ Good time management with the ability to multitask, prioritize and deliver to schedule
	+ Highly motivated and proactive nature, constantly looking at methods for improvement
	+ Solution focused and has strong attention to detail
	+ Experience working with Business Owners and different stakeholders to gather data requirements and provide solutions
	+ CI/CD tools like Teamcity, GitHub Actions Jenkins, Harness or Circle.c
	+ Infrastructure as code utilities like Terraform, Cloudformation.
	+ Docker and Kubernetes.
	+ Good knowledge of SQL, Snowflake, dbt, Python, AWS, AWS Serverless (Lambda Functions), SQS, \-SNS, S3, Glue,
	+ Clear and concise oral \& written communication including technical documentation
	+ Experienced in orchestration tools (such as Apache Airflow, Prefect)
	+ Proficient in roll out and maintenance of cloud infrastructure
	+ Knowledge of data requirements for ML / AI use cases beneficial
	+ ***CDP implementation experience is plus***

**Why Xero?**
Offering very generous paid leave to use however you’d like (plus statutory holidays!), dedicated paid leave to care for your physical and mental wellbeing as well as an Employee Assistance Program to access mental health care for you and your family, health insurance, life insurance, and income protection, wellbeing and sports programmes, employee resource groups, 26 weeks of paid parental leave for primary caregivers, an Employee Share Plan, beautiful offices, flexible working, career development, and many other benefits that reflect our human value, you’ll do the best work of your life at Xero.

title: Senior Business Analyst, Portfolio Management
description:
**Overview**

As a Technical Business Analyst, you will collaborate with Project Managers, business leaders, and cross\-functional teams to document and deliver business and technical requirements throughout project phases. You’ll assist with reports and briefs for senior leadership, coordinate resources, and support team collaboration. Your role includes facilitating workshops, gathering feedback, and obtaining formal sign\-off from stakeholders. You should have experience producing high\-quality Business Requirements and Functional Specifications, as well as screen flows. You will apply project lifecycle standards and methodologies, leveraging tools and people effectively to achieve objectives within scope, budget, and timelines. Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to work in collaborative environments and manage ambiguity are essential. You will also work with the Portfolio Manager to identify and implement continuous improvements in your role.  



  

**Key Accountabilities and main responsibilities**

**Strategic Focus**

* Drive the definition of business problems via in\-depth investigation and gathering of technical and non\-technical information.
* Outline detailed business requirements and detailed technical requirements for a solution and ensure the delivered solution meets those business requirements.
* Traceability between the technical and functional requirements and the development and then testing of same.

**Operational Management**

* Identify stakeholders and facilitate discussions or workshops to understand needs, requirements, and priorities.
* Gather, validate, and document business and technical requirements/use cases.
* Analyse data to inform and validate opportunities and requirements.
* Model business processes and identify opportunities for process improvements.
* Analyse impacted systems and detail changes needed for efficient development.
* Understand customer experience and how it influences business and technical requirements.
* Collaborate with teams to solve business challenges and create clear, concise requirements.
* Develop and improve Analyst methodologies and processes for continuous improvement.
* Create dashboards and reports for portfolio analysis, such as Requirement/Epic/Story breakdowns.
* Analyse backlogs and identify synergies between projects for efficiency.
* Store and host business and technical requirements to build a knowledge base for future use.
* Chair and facilitate a center of excellence for Analyst roles.
* Provide recommendations for continuous improvement and role efficiency at the portfolio level.
* Support or perform functional testing and report issues to Developers.
Ensure testing is documented and collaborate with the Test Lead and Project Manager for adequate coverage.  
* 

**People Leadership**

* Be a natural leader in your field so you can guide, coach and develop team members on complex issues with practical workable approaches/solutions leading to long term skill growth.
* Build productive and professional relationships with key stakeholders, other cross\-functional team members and Senior Leadership roles.
Display role model behaviors with facilitation, communication, and collaboration  
* 

  

**Experience \& Personal Attributes**

* 5\+ years of experience as a Technical Business Analyst covering both Business and Technical Requirements.
* Proficient in project management fundamentals and how the Analyst role contributes (estimation, planning, risk management, change management, etc.).
* Experienced in using project management and scheduling software.
* Skilled in creating reports, charts, and graphs for executive presentations.
* Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite, Service Now, Jira, and SharePoint.
* Knowledge and experience in Agile delivery practices.
* Experience working with multiple business and technical delivery teams.
* Ability to work well under pressure, manage ambiguity, and be self\-driven.
* Strong presentation skills and experience educating staff on new concepts and processes.
Excellent analytical, presentation, and communication skills (oral and written).  
* 

**Some of our Employment Benefits**  

  



* FlexiWorks – enabling our employees to work in the office and at home
* Purchased Leave, Parental Leave, Volunteer Leave, Gender transition leave, Well\-being leave
* Employee Recognition Program \- to recognise people who are demonstrating our values and Company purpose.
* Talent Referral Program
* Salary Sacrificing via Superannuation
* Employee Assistance Program

title: Senior IT Business Analyst
description:

* Work for an iconic Australian brand!
* Hybrid working conditions, 3 days WFH


Seeking a motivated IT BA to take accountability for support and delivery within the SAP environment, contribute to projects and CI initiatives.
The Role
Based at our Port Melbourne site in a hybrid working arrangement, we have an excellent opportunity for an experienced IT Business Analyst who is looking for their next role in a complex environment.
Reporting to the IT Systems Manager, this role has accountability for the support and delivery of the SAP environments across the Bega Dairy and Drinks business, and integration with a range of other non\-SAP applications. This role offers the chance to lead smaller projects and play a key role in larger initiatives.
Our Port Melbourne site is not only the home of Vegemite it is also the home of other Australian iconic products, such as Bega Peanut Butter, Bega Simply Nuts, Zoosh and Cream Cheese. VEGEMITE has been proudly made in Port Melbourne, Australia since 1923\.
Responsibilities* Apply subject matter expertise of Finance/Controlling to assist in day\-to\-day operation in production support and driving continuous improvement.
* Provide and coordinate support and maintenance activities across a range of integrated non\-SAP Bega Dairy and Drinks applications.
* Assure the delivery of outsourced ERP services to ensure that service quality meets agreed expectations and contract conditions
* Assist with coordinating projects on behalf of the BDD Systems team, primarily with respect to projects within the pipeline.
* Work with their business stakeholders to determine, prioritise and execute activities to support business initiatives


About you* 5\+ years in service management, systems analyst or business analyst roles
* 5\+ years finance controlling experience SAP FICO strongly preferred
* FMCG experience preferred
* Vendor management experience, including offshore (e.g Capgemini)
* Experience in problem and incident management, preferably with ITIL knowledge


The Bega Group Story
The Bega Group is home to many trusted and iconic food and beverage brands. Whether it’s VEGEMITE on toast, a Big M on the go or a Zooper Dooper on a hot day \- you've probably grown up enjoying the iconic products we proudly manufacture every day.
Our growth story of becoming a successful ASX 200 listed company with an annual turnover in excess of $3 billion and approximately 4,000 employees, is made possible by our dedicated workforce who live and breathe our values every day. We have a strong regional focus and proudly support the communities where we work, live and play. At the Bega Group, we are proud of our heritage and will continue to build great opportunities to encourage our people to develop and thrive. Come and be a part of our success story as we continue to build The Great Australian Food Company through creating Great Food for a Better Future!  

Life at the Bega Group
Company culture and our values are very important to us. From flexible working arrangements and regular social catch ups, we’re committed to fostering a supportive and agile work environment for our team.* Join a dedicated, forward\-thinking and innovative culture
* Grow with us, through opportunities for career development and progression
* Contribute by giving back to your community through charities we partner with
* Access to mental and physical health programs through our wellbeing portal and programs
* Enjoy excellent employee benefits, including flexible working, purchased leave options and salary continuance insurance


Applications
At the Bega Group, diversity and inclusion is a business priority, we want everyone to be themselves regardless of their background, religion, sexual orientation, age or gender so we can truly reflect the customers and communities that we serve. No matter how you identify, we encourage talented people from all backgrounds, abilities, and identities to apply to work at the Bega Group.
We will accept applications from all people with the right to live and work in Australia.

title: Senior Business Analyst
description:
**Job no:** 50009559  

**Work type:** Full Time  

**Location:** Melbourne \- North  


* Be part of an innovative team that values collaboration and growth.
* Contribute to sustainability initiatives that make a difference.
* Take advantage of Career growth opportunities


Visy is powering the circular economy, closing the loop between packaging, recycling and remanufacturing. We believe materials are not truly recycled until they’re made into something new—and it all starts with Visy Recycling. As Australia’s largest recycler, our extensive network of recycling operations is integrated with our manufacturing sites. We collect and sort recyclable materials like paper, cardboard, glass, plastics and metals from households and businesses, and locally remanufacture them back into new, sustainable packaging.


**Role Details**



As a Senior Business Analyst, located in Tullamarine, and reporting to the Business Integration Manager (Recycling, National), you will be at the forefront of driving efficiency and innovation in our recycling operations. You’ll work cross\-functionally to analyze business needs, identify opportunities for improvement, and implement solutions that enhance our sustainability efforts and profitability.


**What you'll do**


* Analyse operational processes and identify opportunities for increased efficiency and cost savings within the recycling value chain.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements, develop business cases, and prioritise projects.
* Design and implement data\-driven strategies to improve collection, sorting, and processing operations.
* Monitor and evaluate industry trends, regulatory changes, and emerging technologies in recycling.
* Develop detailed reports and presentations to communicate findings and recommendations.
* Lead workshops and facilitate discussions to identify pain points and define innovative solutions.
* Support the implementation of new systems or processes, ensuring seamless integration with existing operations.


**What You Will Bring**


* 5\+ years in business analysis, with a focus on sustainability, waste management, or recycling preferred.
* Bachelor’s degree in Business, Environmental Science, Engineering, or a related field (Master’s degree preferred).
* Strong analytical skills with expertise in data modelling, process mapping, and forecasting.
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management abilities.
* Proven ability to lead cross\-functional teams and drive projects to successful completion.
* Knowledge of recycling regulations, market dynamics, and sustainability initiatives is an advantage.


**What you’ll love when you join us**


* Be part of a company making a real impact on the environment.
* Opportunity to work on cutting\-edge projects and shape the future of recycling.
* A supportive, innovative, and growth\-oriented workplace.


*Ready to make a difference? and be a key player in shaping our future!*


* You will be required to meet Visy’s employment criteria which will include a criminal history check and pre\-employment medical (including drug \& alcohol testing)
* Visy is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion.
* These roles are only open to candidates currently residing in Australia with full working rights


**Advertised:** 03 Dec 2024 AUS Eastern Daylight Time  

**Applications close:** 27 Dec 2024 AUS Eastern Daylight Time

**Your responsibilities will include:**

\-Adjusting, repairing, and replacing faulty components, followed by testing with electronic instruments.

\-Setting up telecommunications equipment such as telephones, switchboards, and data transmission devices.

\-Integrating and configuring telecommunications equipment.

\-Attaching and connecting wires and cables to various appliances and equipment.

\-Installing cabling systems for telephone, radio, pay TV, and computer networks.

\-Joining cables and sealing sheaths using materials like lead and thermoplastic.

\-Performing fibre installation tasks, including preparation, handling, hygiene, and termination of Ribbon \& Multi\-core fibres.

\-Locating faults in telecommunications systems using tools like ohmmeters, voltmeters, ammeters, and transmission measuring instruments.

\-Conducting safety and quality inspections, along with reporting non\-conformance issues.

\- Qualification equivalent to AQF Cert IV or higher or min 4 years relevant work experience.

title: Lead Business Analyst
description:
If you live in Australia or New Zealand, you’ve likely heard of AMP. But at a time when society is changing, we are too. We’re now a nimbler business with new leadership and thinking.


For us, these are exciting times. There’s a real potential for big thinkers to help us redefine what financial services could be. And turn our legacy into something even more positive and powerful for the future.


**Help people create their tomorrow, while you create yours**

We help people with their banking, super, retirement and finances. Through upturns, downturns, recessions, and major life transitions. Every day, we help people see and make more of their financial potential, so that they can create their tomorrow. And we’ve been doing it for over 170 years.


If we do our job well, we genuinely add to the prosperity of our country and its people.


**How you'll make an impact**

As a Lead Business Analyst in AMP's North Technology team, you'll be the critical bridge between business strategy and technological execution for one of the leading Wrap platforms in the Wealth market. Your role will be pivotal in translating complex business objectives into actionable requirements that drive innovative solutions across the North platform. By working closely with stakeholders from Client Services, Platform, Product, and Sales \& Distribution teams, you'll shape the strategic direction of a best\-in\-class wealth management solution, ensuring that technology delivers tangible business value and meets the evolving needs of financial services.


**What you will bring to the role**

You'll bring deep expertise in business analysis, with a comprehensive understanding of both Agile and Waterfall delivery methodologies and extensive experience in Wrap, Wealth and Superannuation platforms. Your exceptional stakeholder management skills, combined with strong technical acumen, will allow you to effectively navigate complex organisational landscapes, facilitate critical workshops and produce high\-quality requirements that bridge business and technology teams. Your ability to coach and mentor other Business Analysts, coupled with your strategic thinking and process improvement mindset, will be crucial in driving continuous innovation and delivering cost\-effective, scalable solutions.


**You’ll thrive here if…**

If you can adapt from BAU to the ambiguous with ease, you’ll do well here. Change is never easy, so bring your commitment, grit and growth mindset.


Because we run lean, you’ll be expected to jump in and deliver across a variety of areas. Meaning, you’ll be closer to the action and executive decisions that influence where we go next.


If you’re someone that can hold their own, you’ll find AMP quite liberating.


**Why we think you’ll love working at AMP**

Doing what we’ve always done is not an option, so your clever ideas will get airtime here. You’ll be encouraged to speak up and try new things. If they don’t work, we move on – better for it.


We know there’s no one way of doing things. So, you won’t have to sacrifice who you are or how you work to fit in here. We’re inclusive and flexible in many of the ways you’d expect. And in some of the ways you wouldn’t. As long as your health and wellbeing come first \- at home and at work.


In fact, most of what makes AMP such a welcoming, enjoyable place to work are our people. Wherever you go, you’ll find moments to connect, feel valued and do meaningful work.


Whether it’s through our first\-class leaders who are invested in you and your success. Through year\-round opportunities to volunteer, fundraise and give back to the community. Or in the everyday challenges you face as we work together to strengthen this great organisation. Challenges that will stretch you, amplify your potential and compound the impact you have.  



  

**We believe in the power of inclusion and diversity**

We’re dedicated to fostering inclusion, diversity, and a warm feeling of belonging at AMP. It sparks creativity, ignites innovation, and turns up the dial on the quality of our decisions and performance. This not only makes our workplace more engaged, but also leads to better connections with our customers.


We're your allies in the search for the perfect fit \- when you apply, let us know how we can support you to put your best self forward during our selection process.


We're also committed to enhancing employment opportunities for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, so we enthusiastically encourage candidates from these backgrounds to apply and explore our Reconciliation Plan on our website


**Ready to create your tomorrow?**

If you’re someone who sees opportunity where others see challenge, come and work with us in smart, progressive ways as we transform an iconic Australian brand for the future. And, through a series of career\-defining moments, create your own tomorrow.


Don’t procrastinate! We review applications when we get them, and if we discover the ideal candidate, we may close the role earlier than the advertised close date.


Looking forward to meeting you.

Downer is the leading provider of integrated services in Australia and New Zealand. **What’s the role all about?**  

  

Ready for your new challenge? Our growing Energy and Utilities business are looking for a new Financial Analyst to join the team. This exciting new in the Finance team will be reporting directly to the Head of Finance and will be based out of our Melbourne office. The main purpose of the role is to provide effective planning, analysis and advice on financial aspects \& risk management including stakeholder management, compliance policy \& group management, and continuous improvement of the EU ANZ finance function.


**What makes you our perfect match?**

* Innovative thinker, always looking for where we can improve

* Demonstrated strong analytical and problem\-solving skills

* Willingness to establish effective working relationships with a variety of people at different levels, both internally and externally

* Provide support to E\&U Finance Performance team and other key stakeholders as required in ensuring the appropriate financial structures, initiatives and processes are in place to enable key targets and requirements are met

**Why Downer?**

* Competitive salary
* Work for a major ASX\-listed company
* Opportunity to work in an agile dynamic environment
* Opportunity to grow your career in a dynamic, fast\-paced environment
* Be part of a supportive, inclusive team where your ideas count

At Downer, we don’t just acknowledge diversity—we celebrate it! With over 33,000 people bringing different backgrounds, experiences, and ideas to the table, you’ll be part of a team where your uniqueness is your greatest strength.


So, what are you waiting for? **Click ‘Apply Now’** and take on your new challenge.
